item.title: Fruit Mountain Party launches in Early Access on August 28
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Combine fruits to make them bigger.

Multiplayer party 3D puzzle game Fruit Mountain Party will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam on August 28, developer BeXide announced.

The Early Access release will feature the core game systems, include single-player and multiplayer versus modes. The full version will implement updates to versus mode, as well as additional content for single-player mode and customization features, and other adjustments and content based on user feedback. It is expected to remain in Early Access for approximately three months.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

A brand new game in the hit 3D puzzle game Fruit Mountain where you combine fruits to make them bigger is finally here!

This time, it’s fruit battles!? There are plenty of versus modes that everyone can enjoy!

Get together for online or local multiplayer and have a blast!

Keep stacking those fruits!

Key Features

  • Heated Online Battle Mode
    • Compete with friends and players from around the world in a battle mode for up to four players!
    • Will you compete in a serious time attack? Or maybe a chaotic battle full of items and unexpected accidents?
    • Get ready for exciting matches with a variety of rules!
  • Single-Player Mode Supports Rankings
    • The single-player mode is still available!
    • Compete with players from around the world for the highest score!
  • Easy to Play
    • Simply throw fruits and stack them on the plate.
    • Combine fruits of the same kind to make them bigger!
    • Game over if the fruits fall off the plate!
    • Create big fruits or trigger chains to boost your score with combo!
    • Hone your stacking skills and compete with your rivals!

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Hello, Mario! app announced for Switch, iOS, and Android alongside My Mario children’s product line
item.content:encoded:
• Smartphone
  • Switch

New product line to be released from August 26.

Nintendo has announced the free app Hello, Mario! for Switch, iOS, and Android as part of “My Mario,” a new series of Mario-themed products for young children to be released from August 26.

Here is an overview of the app, via Nintendo:

A free smart device app and Nintendo Switch software that children can play intuitively by pulling Mario’s face, or turning it around and around on the screen. Mario will react in various ways based on the player’s input, allowing parents and young children to play together and enjoy each reaction they see.

And here is a look at the app in action, via its official website:


Other products part of the “My Mario” series, which will be sold at Nintendo Tokyo, Nintendo Osaka, and Nintendo Kyoto, include:

Wood Block Sets

Characters such as Mario and Luigi, along with well-known items from the Super Mario series will be available as wooden blocks. These pieces are all made in sizes and weights that are easy for young children to hold and play with. Each character blocks can also be used as an amiibo figure of the relevant character in compatible games.

  • Mario Wood Block Set (3 pieces) – 2,980 yen
  • Mario & Friends Wood Block Set (30 pieces) – 19,980 yen

Board Book

Hello, Mario! is a board book that parents and children can enjoy together one page at a time, opening Mario’s mouth, or turning his face around. (The book will be available at local bookstores as well.)

  • Hello, Mario! (published by Shogakukan) – 1,870 yen

Visual Content

In this series of stop motion short videos, Mario shows a variety of expressions and movements. Each video is approximately one minute long so that young children can enjoy them. The videos are planned to be released on the My Mario official website and other channels.

  • It’s Me, Mario! Stop Motion Shorts – free

item.title: WitchSpring R for Xbox One launches August 22 alongside free DLC ‘The Follower’s Fall’
item.content:encoded:
WitchSpring R will launch for Xbox One alongside its free downloadable content “The Follower’s Fall” on August 22 at 10:00 a.m. PT / 1:00 p.m. ET, developer Kiwi Walks announced.

The downloadable content will include “post-ending stories of the main characters, tales of new warlords, and a new storyline centered on a mysterious follower,” as well as full voice acting in both Japanese and Korean.

Here is a new piece of key art in commemoration of the announcement:

WitchSpring R is currently available for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC via Steam.
